title: Music Fans Are Drowning Out the Fed
sub_head: For now, the music industry is growing too strongly to worry about rising interest rates
body:
Music assets are a hit when interest rates are low, but will investors change their tune as the Fed introduces hikes?
Money has been pouring into music catalogs. Major record labels, private-equity firms and specialist funds such as Hipgnosis last year spent a total of more than $12 billion on the rights to songs by artists such as Tina Turner and The Beach Boys, data from consulting firm MIDiA Research shows. The tally was more than double the previous record set in 2020.
